alert.note: Alert for Anne Arundel; Howard; Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 07 at 2:26AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Maryland, including the following counties: northern Anne Arundel, extreme southeastern Howard, and northwestern Prince Georges Counties. * WHEN...Until 830 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 224 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia... Pinehurst... Bowie... Severn... Annapolis... College Park... Crofton... Greenbelt... Langley Park... Beltsville... Elkridge... Riviera Beach... Bladensburg... Naval Academy... Baltimore-Washington Airport... Fort Smallwood State Park...
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
